org.fcrepo.client

Interface FedoraObject

  • All Superinterfaces:
    FedoraResource
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FedoraObjectImpl

    public interface FedoraObject
extends FedoraResource
    A Fedora Object, a Resource which can contain Datastreams and/or other Objects.
    Since:
    2014-08-01
    Author:
    escowles

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FedoraObject createObject()
      Create a new resource with a repository-supplied path contained within the resource exposed by this FedoraObject instance.
      Collection<FedoraResource> getChildren(String mixin)
      Get the Object and Datastream nodes that are children of the current Object.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.fcrepo.client.FedoraResource

        copy, createVersionSnapshot, delete, forceDelete, forceMove, getCreatedDate, getEtagValue, getLastModifiedDate, getMixins, getName, getPath, getProperties, getSize, isWritable, move, removeTombstone, removeTombstone, updateProperties, updateProperties

    • Method Detail

      • getChildren

        Collection<FedoraResource> getChildren(String mixin)
                                throws FedoraException
        Get the Object and Datastream nodes that are children of the current Object.
        Parameters:
        mixin - If not null, limit to results that have this mixin.
        Throws:
        FedoraException

      • createObject

        FedoraObject createObject()
                   throws FedoraException
        Create a new resource with a repository-supplied path contained within the resource exposed by this FedoraObject instance.
        Returns:
        a FedoraObject representing the created resource.
        Throws:
        FedoraException - if an error occurs while making the requests against the repository.
